article: Annie Oakley was born on a farm in Ohio, USA in 1860. She was a sharp-shooting star of the Wild West and died in 1926, at the age of 66. As a child, she used to _ her father and his friends shoot animals: she wanted to try, too. They laughed at her because they thought she was not _ enough to hold a gun properly. But she _ them all by learning to shoot and becoming very good at it. Annie _ a marksman whom she met at a shooting competition. Together they started their own shooting show and they _ in variety shows around the country. When Annie Oakley was twenty-five, the legendary Buffalo Bill saw her perform and said her skills _ a bigger, better-known show. That year, she and her husband _ the famous ''Buffalo Bill's Wild West Show''. For seventeen years, Annie was part of the show and was the main _ . She was such a good shot that she could split a playing card from theside, _ ten meters away. She could hit a coin _ in the air and even shoot cigarettes held between her husband's _ . When Annie was forty-one, she was seriously _ in a train crash. Everyone thought that would be the end of her _ . But she _ quickly and soon she was well enough to continue to _ her audiences. In 1946, twenty years after her _ , a musical called Annie Get Your Gun was written about Annie Oakley. _ , she was much quieter in real life than the _ in the musical. Some of the stories about her shooting skills are almost too _ to be true. Annie Oakley has become a legendary figure of the Wild West.
